title: Tower team have true heart
body: I was under the tower team as have a history of anxiety and depression. I had a very difficult pregnancy this time right from the start with many tests and a lot of uncertainty. The Tower team were always available to answer questions and if the couldn’t answer them one individual in particular took it upon themselves to find out for me. I never had to wait long for an answer.  Sadly my baby died at 20 weeks. The downside is the Tower team were not called on to be Bt here with me when or after I got the news . This is the only negative, I felt that the point of being under their care would mean I would see someone whom I’d be talking to consistently at such a horrible time. In addition to that the recommendation’ I was given not to have a surgical extraction I felt was mismanaged especially as I had PTSD from my last labour and history of mental health concerns.

title: Fantastic commitment to their patients
body:
My whole family has just attended the surgery for the annual flu jab, and I feel compelled to praise the staff for the amazing organisation and professionalism. It could have felt impersonal with the amount of patients they had to vaccinate today, but you are still welcomed warmly and very much treated as an individual, and even finding the time to help my mum who has Alzheimer’s be reunited with me when finished. I cannot thank enough all the doctors, nurses and receptionist that were involved today. 
Fairfield Park Health Centre in my opinion is the best surgery within Bath, and my family could not be in better hands. 
Thanks to you all for caring so much for all your patients.

title: A&E needs to have social distancing restrictions
body: Visited A&E approx 20:15 on 17 September 2020. It was very busy. No social distancing restrictions in the seating area, people were wearing masks, but there should be some restrictions put in place to ensure social distancing.

title: Wonderful surgery
body: My husband and I had our flu jabs today ; we were so pleased to be called for our injections especially as the large majority of our friends have been unable to get their own jabs . We feel very lucky that we are patients of the chipping surgery and the service it gives us .

title: Flu Jab clinic.
body: I turned up a few minutes before the required time and followed the signs for the clinic. Temperature taken, filled in form, got jab and walked out the rear exit in less than two minutes. Social distancing observed throughout and very professional service- I was impressed. Thank you.

title: Flu jab
body: Excellent drive through flu jab service many thanks. Quick and efficient. Friendly staff explained everything really well

title: Aspen Medical Center
body: My GP practice at Saintbridge was merged under Aspen and it was terrible, but that is change, a few years on and I wouldn’t go anywhere else for treatment.  The change in general practice especially under these current circumstances are challenging but the Practice has worked hard to turn this around.  Today showcased the amazing forward thinking with the launch of the flu campaign.  This got a 10 out of 10 from me.  Staff at the point of queuing were polite and helpful, the staff at booking you in were very pleasant, the route through the Center had been well set up, including support for patients that could not use the stairs, the nurses giving the flu jab were just awesome and to top it off members from the PPG provided a great experience.  The whole process reminded me of the queues at Disney and the experience was just as good.  Aspen should be congratulated on the way they have changed to provide 21st century care and under the current conditions give me the confidence that we will continue to get first class care.  Thank you to all staff at Aspen

title: Friendly practice
body: Had a drive through flu jab, very efficient and friendly staff it’s the first time I’ve had a drive through flu jab

title: Excellent service
body:
May I congratulate all the staff at Milford Medical for the highly efficient   way the flu clinic was conducted today-Saturday. Such a smooth operation  doesn’t just happen but the result of many hours of preparation. I was most impressed by the professional and friendly way all the the staff  cared for the patients. 

My thanks and congratulations to you all.

Sue Mitchell

title: Drive through flu jab
body: Excellent, like a military operation, unbelievably efficient, at the same time very friendly. Well done 👍

title: Flue jab drive in
body: Very well organised an supported booking easily done plenty people to make the operation very acceptable

title: Cleanliness concern
body:
1. The phlebotomist did not change her gloves in between cleaning the surfaces and taking my blood. 

2. There were 2 phlebotomists aswell as my self in the consulting room. It was impossible to maintain social distancing in such a confined space. I can not understand the need for two phlebotomists. Only necessary members of staff should be in the room to limit contact.

3. The marked line on the floor at the reception desk does not prevent patients crossing over. There should be a table or barrier between the reception desk and patient to ensure social distancing is maintained. Both receptionists repeatedly had to inform numerous patients to stand back. 

4. There is no access to hand sanitiser for patients besides the one bottle that sits on the reception desk, which is wrongly placed as you have to step over the marked line putting the reception staff at risk. Hand sanitiser should be easily accessed, especially during this COVID-19 period. 

5. It is understandable that the staff can not clean the patient seating area between every patient. Therefore there should be an availability of wipes and bins for patients to clean the seats between use.

title: Seal unit and ward 38
body: Though I was in great pain, every member of staff made feel I was being looked after, from the seal unit to the recovery ward. I wish to thank all of them especially the ones I can't mention by name. Thank you

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Flu drive through
body: Excellent flu injection drive through , efficient quick and simple . Great idea.  So much better than GP visit.

title: Flu clinic
body: Today we went to Danbury to have flu vaccine and I was very impressed with how professional, polite and friendly the staff were. The clinic was very well organised and we were in and out in no time at all! I was also impressed with how ‘COVID-safe’ the process was.

title: Flu jab
body: Great service today for flu jab. Easy to book. Well coordinated, easy to follow signs on the floor. Well done.

title: Excellent reception staff
body: Called Ivy Grove surgery yesterday morning to register and book in for an appointment due to some health concerns. The reception staff were excellent. One of the ladies in particular went out of her way to help me and got me registered and an appointment slot with a doctor in less than an hour. I’m guessing that, in the current climate, she is extremely busy and so the fact that she got this done for me so quickly is really, really appreciated. She could not have been more helpful. I’m unable to name her due to the NHS review guidelines, however, I hope she sees this, knows it’s her and can see how grateful I am! Thank you again.

title: Good Dental help
body: The dental experience by clinicians has been excellent. However the administration leaves a lot to be desired.   I was informed that an MRI scan would be arranged for me at the QE.   Owing to Covid19 the appointment at the QE (following my dental appointment in March) took till July to be received.   I attended on 28 July at the QE but instead of an MRI scan I was given a CT Scan. I queried this but was told that I would be seen at the Maxifacial clinic at QE. I tried to explain that the request had been made by my clinician at the Dental Hospital and that I thought I was having an MRI but to no avail.  I have now found out that no details of the scan from QE has been forwarded to the Dental Hospital because they are unable to receive it. In any case if I was to have a CT scan I could have had it at the Dental Hospital and thus avoided leaving my home during lockdown with a vulnerable husband and having to travel by train. My NHS dentist has not received the scan.

title: Excellent practice
body: It’s an organised and very efficient practice and all of staaf as well. I am pleased with the service and satisfied.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
The service and level of care offered by this practice is exceptional. Starting from when I call the surgery where I am always treated with the upmost kindness by the reception staff who are very welcoming. They try to help me as much as possible and go out of their way to provide answers to my questions, provide support and booking appointments with ease,whilst acting in a very professional manner. No matter how difficult the situation is. The GP's and the team of clinicians are excellent. They always take their time to listen to you and never make you feel like you are wasting their time. They are extremely polite, highly qualified, reassuring and trustworthy. They have treated me with the upmost respect and dignity in every consultation  where they always try to accommodate my needs and put their patients care first. Due to this I felt very comfortable in my recent virtual consultation. I found no difference in the level of care provided and I was left extremely satisfied without even visiting the practice. 

I am grateful for the care I have recieved at this practice despite the fact GP surgeries are facing immense pressure due to the covid-19 pandemic.
Well done.

title: Great Care
body: I had a biopsy required as an operation for cancer. Due to Covid I had to travel to London as UCHL was the only hospital doing this type of procedure. Due to an issue during the operation I was admitted to CCU. I cannot praise enough the 2 teams that looked after me during the night of 18th September and the morning of 19th September. These 2 teams could not do enough for me (and the other patients in the ward) and their enthusiasm was second to none. Apart from being asked if I was from Birmingham (not what a Black Country boys wants to hear) I cannot praise the teams enough.

title: Can't praise them enough.
body:
I self referred myself due to breathing difficulties, following three weeks of illness, beginning with the onset of Coronavirus symptoms. I suffer from asthma and was struggling to catch my breath.
I informed the reception team of my situation and that my home test had proven negative, I waited less than 10 minutes which I was very impressed with.
The nurses where thorough in their questioning, did everything I would expect regarding the current situation, temperature check, checking the symptom list and so on.
I was incredibly well looked after, I had blood taken, an X-ray, steroids and a nebulizer, the staff where very friendly and attentive, and not once did I feel ignored.
I have had reason to visit my local hospital on numerous occasions over the last five years or so and have always been impressed with the professionalism of the Nhs staff and their support workers.
I was sent home with solid, clear advice and medication to ease my breathing.
Despite everything these people are up against they do a fantastic job and I for one would happily support and recommend Cheltenham General Hospital.

title: Very well organised
body: This years flu jab had to be done outside of the surgery for obvious reasons. I must say I was very impressed with the way it was organised and handled by the staff. Staff were very friendly and and helpful. It was done so quickly and professionally. Well done Maples for making this a very easy experience. Thank you

title: Great experience
body: The way this year's flu jab's were carried out was very impressive. A totally new way due to the current situation but was carried out very efficiently and professionally by staff. We was dealt with very fast with no waiting about. Thank you to all the staff for making this a very easy experience.

title: it's a brilliant place to release your arthritis…
body:
the treatment is brilliant,
I couldn't walk properly, arthritis all over my body in every joints. and after the first treatment, I was walking without my walking stick. I have be going every two weeks now. its brilliant. 
I am now doing things I could not do, isn't that fantastic. its a God sent place.and ever one is very friendly and welcoming. thank you Mersea Rd clinic. Shirley xx

title: wonderful care while in A UMA and 6A SOUTH
body: Every memberwas staff was caring and proffesional. They were so kind. I had a loss of kidney function - down to 9% - which was frightening. They made me feel safe. My kidneys are now back to normal. I will always be grateful for the care they gave me, especially as my family couldnt visit due to the corona virus. We will always be grateful to the NHS. Thank you all so much.

title: Amazing treatment
body: Arrived with severe relief nose bleed. Was seen by Dr and inspected my nose, decided quartering wasn’t possible. Treated Alternatively,  which was painful and was released home the following day. ALL nurses and staff and Drs were extremely efficient and Professional and advised me of every step of the process. Amazing NHS treatment

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent prompt care
body: Urgent medical problem developed on a Friday afternoon- my relative was triaged, seen face to face at the surgery, given antibiotics and referred on for a hospital appointment, all within an hour of the original phone call. The doctors was lovely- thank you very much.

title: Need to review booking procedures
body:
I have been asked to book a telephone appointment to review one of my medications.   I thought that, given the current pressure that GP services are under, it would be most sensible to do this on-line.  I am in no rush so expected a long wait for an appointment.
Booking on-line is not available.
So, reluctantly I decided to phone.  I found myself 9th in the queue and duly waited.  Gradually the numbers reduced and I was now number one.  This was after waiting 25 minutes.  Oh well I thought, the practice is busy and I’m in no rush.  Then suddenly I was cut off. 
You can imagine that I was not best pleased.
So if the doctor requests that you get an appointment there needs to be a better way of achieving this in the current climate.  I am not going to try again and, although my situation is not particularly urgent, how many more important cases are slipping through the net.
Please review the approach to appointment making and do something about it.  How about a call back service for non-urgent cases for when your staff have a spare minute?

title: Lack of effective distancing procedures in…
body:
Attended for a minor procedure as an out patient.
Reception area was extremely busy with no- one able to observe 1m distance rule due to lack of space . Entrance doorway is small with people queuing within the doorways and people who were exiting brushing past. 6 chairs opposite the reception area tightly packed with hardly 0.5m gap  - 2 of the chairs set by a door where staff were coming and going and again brushing past seated patients. Other people continuously walking closely past this area.
Another area has 3 rows of seats in line - but this was the main route through to other department -so people were walking through - again passing within cm of seats.
Waited in the reception area for 45 minutes and felt the most unsafe I have been since self isolating for 6 months. Very disturbing that I have been so meticulous about distancing for 6 months -  but then encountered the worst example of overcrowding and lack of efficient distancing procedures.
Seemed very chaotic and badly organised.
Having been coughed over by a fellow patient who was seated close/next to me  - who took his mask off to blow his nose - I am seriously worried whether my health has been compromised.

title: Flu jab clininc
body: Excellent experience this morning.  Extremely well organised, fast moving, socially distanced queue and painless injection. Bravo MVP at Callowland!!

title: Efficient & helpful service
body: An amazingly efficient service in providing 'flu injections. Time slots were organised alphabetically, distancing was ensured, several doctors provided a very rapid service and Covid security was maintained throughout. Brilliant!

title: Wouldn't go again
body: I felt that the nurse wasn't very polite, caring or considersate. The nurse put words in to my mouth and made her own analysis while contradicting herself. She made me feel more down and upset when I left, she wasn't bothard about my care or welfare just wanted me out. I spent more time in the waiting room than speaking to her, I regret going.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Drive Through Flu Jab
body: Excellent service Helpful and well organised staff very efficient and well thought out system of control 5Stars

title: Flu clinic
body:
Excellent well organised and highly efficient.  Felt really safe the way it was organised.
Thanks to all the staff for the organization.

title: Flu vaccination
body: Very well organised vaccinations at Turnford Place. The marshals were very helpful too.  Very impressed

title: Very positive experience
body:
Woodlands was very clean, and professional, I felt reassured that all possible measures were taken to limit risk from Covid 19.
I was attending for quite a lengthy mri scan that potentially could have been quite stressful. The radiographers however were very attentive, considerate and professional, taking the time to explain the whole procedure thoroughly. I could definitely recommend this facility based on this experience.

title: Drive through flu jab
body: Had my yearly flu jab yesterday and this year it was given as a drive through.  The staff were very friendly and helpful and the system was well organised and worked perfectly.

title: Great, friendly practice
body: I attended a walk in flu clinic and was extremely impressed by how clean and well organised this surgery was. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful none more so than the doctor himself administering the jabs. Thank you for making me feel so safe!

title: Thank you Day Care
body: I would like to convey my thanks to the lovely Day Care Ward at Kingsmill where I was cared for on the 9th September for a Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy. The staff were wonderful making the experience as non stressful as possible

title: Drive thru flu vaccine
body: Whoever thought of and organised this should join the government not only did I get a dose of vaccine I got a dose of common sense as well fast and efficient good work maples thank you xx

title: Great practice
body: Very efficient flu day. Felt safe and cared for. Would recommend this practice to anyone new to Bushey or watford

title: Streamlined flu vaccinations
body: We had flu jabs; my husband yesterday and I today, 20th September. It was very streamlined and quick. All patients had temperature checks on arrival. All staff on duty helpful and cheerful. Thank you!

title: Great practice
body: Flu clinic was amazing so well organised...as a vulnerable older person I felt completely safe and comfortable

title: Big thank you for efficient, friendly service for…
body: The flu jab clinic this year was managed in an efficient, well organised manner. It was made extremely easy to pass through the clinic, receiving the jab along the way. The staff were all very friendly and reassuring in a difficult situation and really made this a less overwhelming experience for vulnerable older people. Thank you!

title: Excellent Practice
body: the surgery has considerably upped the game. The surgery is the best you can get it is the NHS that is failing. Overfunded and money wasted lack of care during Covid.

title: Flu jab 2020
body: Swift, efficient, socially distanced, clean, reassuring, virtually painless! No waiting, no hanging about, good show!

title: Terrible Doctors
body: When visiting one of the GPs in this practise for a consultation as well as a review, my parent was told they would leave treating the problem till it  effected my  parents quality of life. This was wrong as I found out later, it should not have been left but dealt with straight away. Also my parent was told that they would not do a blood pressure review as there was a machine in reception & to do it them self, my parent is 87 & does not understand technology. The doctors in this practise can be rude, nasty & have no bed side manner at all.

title: Walk-in flu jab
body: Very well organised and friendly service this morning. Very efficient, kept everyone moving along whilst keeping us all socially distanced :)

title: Excellent Flu Clinic
body:
Text sent from Practice, offering an appointment.
Clinic running on time and with excellent Covid precautions.
Doctor came to the car to administer the vaccine as Mum would struggle to get into the surgery. Doctor lovely to Mum, as always. 
All staff cheerful and efficient.
And all before the end of September.
Exceptional service.

title: Fabulous staff
body: Had to undergo a biopsy,,, so quick, so not as bad as my thinking, great staff, had nice atmosphere,,, fabulous rappore with us patients, felt at ease, all was explained, all lovely clean,  great experience in the situation, Thankyou all so much appreciated,,

title: Incredible understanding
body:
I attended for a screening in January and then for my autism assessment in August. The staff we impeccably understanding and reassured me at every stage I couldn't have got through this without them and I am so thankful for the support they showed me. I have now recieved my diagnosis and attending clinic to receive the support I deserve that I never thought I ever did. Finally after all this time realising my potential and starting to understand myself with a positive outlook for the future with the support I am receiving from the team.

I cant thank you enough for everything you have done and continue to do for me I would recommend this service to anyone as it's been my life line.

title: Flu Programme
body: I took myself and my mother to have our flu vaccinations yesterday.  I just want to say how efficiently and professionally it was carried out. When I saw the long queue I nearly didn’t go in. All in all from queuing to receiving the injections it took less than 10 minutes. I was very impressed. Thank you everyone involved.

title: Flu Clinic
body: Excellent facility, very well organised, staff helpful, process very quick; felt much safer than being inside the surgery.

title: Reassuring staff
body:
A big thanks to the staff on Gynae out patients where I arrived for a Hysteroscooy. 
Although I now need to go back To the hospital in the near future, the two nurses and Consultant who were  conducting procedure were brilliant.  Very understanding and reassuring.
Thanks guys . Brilliant team.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body: Both me and my husband had flu jab done .Very efficient and quick.Staff were calm and friendly.Don't know what would have happened if it had rained as it was done outside in the car park under gazebos.

title: Very Efficient
body: My husband and myself have a lot of medical conditions and I have been in shielding since March.  We have had a few minor issues in the past before the pandemic, but we have been really impressed at the efficiency and help we have received in the last six months.  A lot of thought and consideration and planning, has been put in place to safeguard everyone especially the vulnerable.  We believe the new system to talk to a GP or member of staff is better now than it has been in the past and maybe something to consider in the future.  We had our flu jabs yesterday and our safety again was undertaken with much care and consideration. Was well organised.  The staff are all friendly and helpful and nothing has been too much trouble.  They take every precaution with PPE as well.  It is a large surgery and I think all their hard work should be recognized.  So we would like to thank them personally and thank them for safeguarding us, especially during this difficult time.  So thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

title: Very efficient practice
body: I attended the Flu clinic on Sunday 20 Sept with nice, friendly helpful staff and very well organised.

title: Very efficient, caring practice
body: All staff employed at this practice which includes doctor, nurse practitioners and administration staff are caring and very efficient.

title: Professional,  caring practice
body:
I went for a flu vaccine. It was well organised and only took 5mins. 
I have since phoned the surgery for medication advice and my GP phoned me back the same day. Pleasant well informed staff who will go above and beyond to help you. 
Thank you for your dedication during this difficult time.

title: influenza vaccination
body: I have just received  a flu jab and was really impressed how  the surgery was organised.  The staff were really friendly and welcoming but conducted with complete proficiency.  There was no worries at all about feeling safe. Well done.

title: Superb practice
body:
I came upon this review page by chance.  It seems only those with negative experiences take the time to compile a review.
Having used this practice for the last 20 yrs, I have been through most stages of life when GP's might be required; pre pregnancy, pregnancy, childhood ailments, teens, menopause, mens health & now with my in laws in later life, dementia etc.
I cannot fault this surgery.  Yes there is always rules in place regarding repeat presciptions & once you know them, its simple.  
If the GP is running late it is because they are with someone who needs more time than expected.
Be nice to the "gatekeeper" & 9 times out of 10, she will be nice back!

title: Flue jab vaccine
body: Yesterday I went for fluejab, it was amazingly organised and very quick service. I got my fluejab within 3 minutes after I arrived there. Well done Mapel surgery.

title: Flu vaccination
body:
What an excellently well-organised flu clinic on Saturday, 19th September 2020 at Stalham Academy.
Thank you

title: Positive experiences
body: Overall my experience of this practice has been positive though it can sometimes be difficult to get an appointment

title: amazing team / senior doctor is wonderwomen
body:
During the week I had rang 111 they never called me back , and the same issue with GP surgery  Whiteley shocking surgery at the best of times  , been feeling unwell for over 3 weeks . e consults via GP surgery were shocking when you have to write SA ✍ about your condition . Felt let down by system decided to use A&E i am so pleased I did they went above and beyond!!!! 

Amazing staff from health care assistants , to Nurses, And doctors. people knock Nhs and QA hospital at times  i could not fault them Nhs should be so proud to have such great team 
They were supportive, polite , quick , understanding.  And attention to detail was second to none 

I received full blood tests,   Xray  
Further advise and support , they took the time to see me and talk to me unlike Whiteley doctor surgery who refused to do my blood test etc . A&E would  run rings around that surgery for being human and treating people with empathy , and being professional

title: small injuries dept
body: wonderful people i fell over and smashed my head on wednesday 16th sept and was treated as soon as i got there no fuss no bother brill p[ace cant praise them enough thank you  kathy burr

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Diverse Staff Team
body:
Some staff add an extra layer protection to the ward, as they are not afraid to challenge bullying behaviour between the service users.   

To me, some of the staff, in my head, I refer to them as the ward's angels.   

This is due to having a diverse staff team.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Had my flu jab done today so easy and straight forward social distancing was really good I was only in there no more then 5 mins

title: Superb treatment
body:
My father was admitted as the result of breathing difficulties, being 95, with some apprehension.
The treatment he received from all the staff was exceptional. Very professional yet caring in every way. He even enjoyed the food! Think this was a major concern.
As the next of kin I was kept informed of every test and procedure and we were fully consulted about his treatment.
The NHS was a hero in our eyes yet again. 10 out of 10!

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: 11 month old unable to get treatment
body:
so now my GP will not give out medication to anyone for the skin and the pharmacist is unable to lrescribe medication to a child under 1yr old.
I am a Foster carer and so I am unable to give a child medication that is not prescribed
This little girl has wing worm and is unable to get treated ... thanks.

title: Amazing staff
body: Visited the practice on Friday and the customer service was very professional. Called up at 7:30am and was seen within a few hours. Thank you for helping me and caring for my family.

title: Multiple failures of administration
body: I attended a confirmed appointment at the practice on 7 Sept. only to be told that my records had been transferred to another practice without my knowledge nor consent. I asked for a repeat prescription and was told that as the practice no longer had my records I would have to be re-registered before this could be done. I have made 3 attempts (one directly with the reception) and the other 2 on-line to make another appointment. In spite of being promised responses within 24 hours of each, I have heard nothing from the practice.

title: Great practice
body: Feeling very safe within the Covid 19 precautions the flu jab was completed cautiously and efficiently. Thank you to all.

title: Flu vaccinations
body: I have just had my 'drive through flu vaccination' at Henstridge Airfield.  I thought it was very well planned, thought through and a brilliant way to get so many people vaccinated in a short time. Text messages beforehand giving information were very clear.  Good job.

title: So kind and caring
body: I'm 40 and had a heart attack, was placed on war 1E a bit shaken and scared, worried about everything. I see the dark side of life thinking worlds a bad place but let me say one thing the nurses, cleaners, assistants and even the young lass who makes great brews are definitely the light in the world, so caring and kind and understanding, you may only be able there eyes but you can see they genuinely care.  The cleaners are doing a great job my rooms spot on.  The nurses and doctors have kept me informed every step,  I seriousily can't thank them enough for supporting me, and looking after me thru this experience, I owe them so much thankyou NHS

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: A brilliant practice
body:
I have been at this practice for 20 years. 
Recently I was very sick.
The care I received was brilliant. 
This practice has always treatment my sickness expertly and with care.
Thank you to everyone at Balfour surgery

title: Diligent and Effective
body: I experienced acute breathlessness.  My thanks to the receptionist and the two GPs, who together arranged appointments, blood tests, a chest X-ray, an ECG, then further investigation for the diagnosis of a blood clot in each lung (pulmonary embolisms) all within the week.  I cannot thank them enough for their diligence and efforts.

title: Bad, just very bad.
body: I know times are difficult, but for four days now I have been trying to get through on the phone in order to get a medication review, thank god it something isn't something urgent eh? But no, it is just not happening. having to hang  on the phone totally negating anything else you may have to do in the day, constant looping of the answering machine, totally inefficient. utterly inconvenient. Rang first thing in the morning at 8 am, got 20 minutes of engaged signal while most of the county was also trying to get through, I am just not doing this anymore, I would recommend this surgery to no one, now off my meds and bubbling with rage.

title: Flu jab
body: Very efficient. Staff outside, wearing protective equipment, as car pulled up.  Dad immobile, so had flu jab in the car, while I was seen immediately in the surgery. Great service.

title: Professional team
body: Efficient and smooth walk in clinic for the flu vaccination, several reminders by text and also opened on Sunday, that is a plus for workers

title: Fantastic hospital
body: I went in for a disectomy. This was my first operation since being an adult so I was a little scared as I didn't know what to expect. All hospital staff were very friendly and helpful. They made me feel very comfortable and relaxed during my stay. I couldn't of wished to be in a better place they are all real life heroes. Thankyou so much to everybody at the hospital

title: Friendly and professional
body:
The staff was very friendly, i felt very safe with the cleanliness well organised was in and out within a few mins. Was worried to go to the surgery as I didn't know what to expect but my worries soon went
Thank you for great services

title: Flu vaccination
body: Attended for my flu vaccination on the 19th September. Quick, efficient well organised service. Social distancing great and staff were lovely

title: Awful service
body: Understandably much has changed. But patients are kept waiting outside whilst the reception staff just ignore them. Staff and managers need to approach this from the point of best patient care which with lack of communication is not being met.

title: Brilliant GP practice
body:
This practice is superb. They not only have friendly and supportive staff, but they will always go above and beyond to help you as a patient. They have supported me over the years with late night appointments, emergency appointments and excellent advice. The reception staff deserve a particular mention, as they’re always professional, helpful and so resilient. 
Thank you so much Priory medical group for everything you do.

title: Excellent treatment
body: Recently admitted to Boddington Ward for a knee replacement.  Would like to say thank you to all involved from admissions, theatre staff, consultant, medical ward staff , physio;s and OT. and all other.  The treatment i received from all members of staff was excellent throughout my 5 day stay.  Nothing Was too much for any of them - procedure and all treatment explained fully. Thank you all so much.  Would appreciate it if these comment are passed onto the Ward staff as well.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: flu jabs
body: my wife and I attended the surgery for our flu jabs. The staff as always were lovely caring and efficient. The whole procedure went like clockwork and took only a couple of minutes. Well done

title: Amazing care
body: Talking to anyone on reception is a pleasure, and considering we’re in a global pandemic, the speedy responses I’ve had to my e-consultation’s over the past couple of months has been amazing. The doctors really do seem to care, thank you so much!

title: Constantly draining experience
body: One thing you need to know about the gynaecology department at St George‘s hospital is that communicating with them is like sending messages into outer space, you never hear back! I have had the misfortune of dealIng with them and it is absolutely draining. They never follow up, the doctor’s secretary never answers an email even when I am in distress, she simply ignores them without any empathy. I have already raised a complaint to which I did not receive a response. It is just not the way to treat a patient particularly when they are undergoing treatment. This quality of service should never be permitted, something has to change.

title: Flu clinic at risk patient
body:
Contacted surgery as not heard about flu appointment was offered an appointment next month I asked reception to look at why I had not been contacted as usually the practice contacts me as I’m 65 plus and diabetic and high cholesterol ... 
Receptionist  said We texted everyone I said I have not got a text then confirmed after oh we haven’t got ur number I was very surprised as I have given both home and mobile previously .. I asked to speak to practice manager said yhey would call back then Asked if I could hold for a minute put me on hold for 20 min then cut me off and sent me a link by text to complain. Not great service !! As I didn’t want to complain I wanted to check how the system failed with the practice manager.. I find it really bad still haven’t heard from practice manager and all I wanted was to book a flu appointment as I was shielding and wanted to protect my self as shielding over and I have been asked to return to work and work in retail ... they also failed to book my diabetes blood test in March I accept it was Covid time so let go and eventually got done in July after chasing them but bearing in mind I’m diabetic and bame they should have made
Sure I was
Contacted especially if I have out of range test

title: Superb
body:
I have needed to attend the practice 3 times with my daughter for blood tests and a gp appointment. 
The covid set up is outstanding. Everything is scrupulously cleaned as patients come and go, the receptionists were smiling despite probably having the most thankless job in the world right now (I have done this job and know how bad it can be under normal circumstances let alone now)
The care given by the nurses and doctors was amazing as always. Calm, unrushed, thorough. 
The stress that all the staff and health care professionals must be bearing every day must be unimaginable but you would not know it. They are so professional and just lovely!
Our family feel so so lucky to be patients at The Cranborne Practice, especially at this crazy time.
Keep up the good work guys. Thank you!

title: Very helpful
body: Hindon Surgery kindly took me on as a temporary patient during and since the Covid lockdown. This was because I was self-isolating in the area but was being treated for cancer in a London hospital. The surgery team could not have been more helpful in organising the blood tests I require. I have also been very impressed with the way they have dealt with the necessary Covid safety measures.

title: Good practice
body: Did not visit surgery in person but my issue was resolved using online service and telephone call with a doctor. Did not have to wait long for a response after submitting my online form.

title: Creme DeLa Creme
body: this is the best surgery Littlehampton has to offer especially being so busy. The appointments are generally on time and yiu never feel hurried. Particularly the younger staff are prepare to listened, however the older ones seem to think the are better and ten to look down their noses. My only negative is the presribing staff should be trained better and told not to give advice on medicines this shoul be done by the Doctor.

title: Great surgery
body: Super practice with great doctors and staff. Very well organised meaning that even on the day emergency appointments to see or speak with a doctor are made available.

title: Excellent flu jab clinic
body: My husband and I were invited to the flu jab clinic which took place on Saturday 19 September. We were dreading attending as there were no "timed"appointments offered. However our fears were quickly allayed as the whole set up was friendly, quick, slick and professional. We were greeted as always by friendly professional staff. We want to say a huge well done and thank you to everyone involved.

title: Annual flu vaccine
body: I attended the surgery to receive the annual flu vaccine. The measure put in place by the surgery whilst in the middle of a pandemic was excellent. Extremely well organised and even made the whole process quite fun whilst remaining completely socially distanced, very quick process indeed. Well done The Meads.

title: Great online service
body: Not sure if this online way of contacting Glenlyn is here to stay or just because of Covid but it’s absolutely great. Very fast and extremely effective.

title: Best doctor ever
body: Doctor Realy cares about his staff and patients and he makes me feel so much better just talking to him, The man Realy cares and I am so greatfull to him.
